data.event: Over 200 years, Scarborough grew from a collection of small rural villages to become a large city with a diverse cultural community.

event.title: was named after the English town of Scarborough, North Yorkshire in 1796

data.event: It was named after the English town of Scarborough, North Yorkshire in 1796 by Elizabeth Simcoe, who was inspired by the Scarborough Bluffs which reminded her of white cliffs near her home.

event.title: became part of Metropolitan Toronto in 1953

data.event: Originally Scarborough Township, it became part of Metropolitan Toronto in 1953, and was renamed as a borough in 1967.

event.title: was renamed as a borough in 1967

data.event: Originally Scarborough Township, it became part of Metropolitan Toronto in 1953, and was renamed as a borough in 1967.

event.title: developed as a suburb of Old Toronto during the Metro Toronto years

data.event: Scarborough rapidly developed as a suburb of Old Toronto during the Metro Toronto years and became a city in 1983.
Scarborough rapidly developed as a suburb of Old Toronto during the Metro Toronto years and became a city in 1983.

event.title: was amalgamated into the city of Toronto in 1998

data.event: Scarborough was amalgamated into the city of Toronto in 1998.
